body_content.explanation: belonging or relating to a religion that worships many gods, especially one that existed before the main world religions:
examples: The Easter egg has both pagan and Christian origins.

body_content.explanation: belonging or relating to a modern religion that includes beliefs and activities that are not from any of the main religions of the world, for example the worship of nature:
examples: The wedding was a pagan ceremony held in a forest.

body_content.explanation: a person who belongs to a religion that worships many gods, especially one that existed before the main world religions:
examples: Originally pagans, the Anglo-Saxons were a Germanic people who invaded Britain in the fifth and sixth centuries.

body_content.explanation: a person who has no religious beliefs:
a person who belongs to a modern religion that includes beliefs and activities that are not from any of the main religions of the world, for example the worship of nature:
examples: They are trying to stop some pagans from doing a nature ceremony.
It is the nonjudgmental nature of pagans that drew her to them.
